newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippines to ease tax rules for foreigners.
newsitem.headline: Philippines to ease tax rules for foreigners.

text.p: The Philippine government plans to automatically exempt foreigners from paying the 20 percent final withholding tax on government securities in a move to draw more investments, Bureau of Treasury director Juanchito Dispo said on Tuesday.
Instead, foreign investors would just pay the taxes required under the bilateral treaties forged with the country's major trading partners, he said.
He cited that U.S. investors would just be charged the 10 percent tax.
By October, the government is expected to put in place a special window that would screen and clear the qualified foreign investors, Dispo said.
Currently, foreign investors have to go to the Bureau of Internal Revenue to get their tax refunds.
